title: baiters/advance_fee/sources/scamorama/marmite_okon.html
notes: That was your basic DEAD BANK CUSTOMER letter.

Thaneof Cawdor

Cc: 	Sir Marmite

Dear Mr Okon

I understand that my good friend and golfing companion Marmite  is on the point of agreeing some profitable business with you. I know that he feels that he may be spreading himself rather too thinly and perhaps I can be of assistance?   I would be keen to take part as, to be frank, my balance at the Banquo Scotland is rather low. A substantial windfall like Marmite has suggested would come in very helpful! Lord Bovril, who comes from excellent stock,  can offer testimonials in my favour should you reqiure these.

I am obliged sir,

Yours

Thane

Thaneof Cawdor
3 Wiches Cauldron
King Duncan Street
Nr. Birnham Wood
Miracskyshire
ENGLAND
UR1 GIT

Thaneof Cawdor
Cc: 	Sir Marmite

Dear Mr Okon

I am happy to be allowed to participate in this scheme and don't see a ghost of chance of it going wrong with us all on board. Let me know what to do and I will be ready in a shake.

Thane

Thaneof Cawdor

GUESS THE OKE'S ON YOU THEN MUGU BOY?

THANE

Thaneof Cawdor
3 Wiches Cauldron
King Duncan Street
Nr. Birnham Wood
Miracskyshire
ENGLAND
UR1 GIT

messages.body:
FROM THE DESK OF MR. GEORGE OKON 
WEMA BANK PLC, 
LAGOS-NIGERIA. 
EMAIL:georgokon1@quick.cz 
DEAR SIR, 
        STRICTLY A PRIVATE BUSINESS PROPOSAL 
I AM  MR. GEORGE OKON, THE MANAGER, BILLS AND
EXCHANGE AT THE FOREIGN REMITTANCE DEPARTMENT OF THE
WEMA BANK PLC. I AM WRITING 
THIS LETTER TO ASK FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND COOPERATION
TO CARRY OUT THIS BUSINESS OPPORTUNITY IN MY
DEPARTMENT. WE DISCOVERED AN ABANDONED SUM  OF
$15,000,000.00 (FIFTEEN MILLION UNITED STATES DOLLARS
ONLY) IN AN ACCOUNT THAT BELONGS TO ONE OF OUR FOREIGN
CUSTOMERS WHO DIED ALONG WITH HIS ENTIRE FAMILY OF A
WIFE AND TWO CHILDREN IN NOVEMBER 1997 IN A PLANE
CRASH. 
SINCE WE HEARD OF HIS DEATH, WE HAVE BEEN EXPECTING
HIS NEXT-OF-KIN TO COME OVER AND PUT CLAIMS FOR HIS
MONEY AS THE HEIR,BECAUSE WE CANNOT RELEASE THE FUND
FROM HIS ACCOUNT UNLESS SOMEONE APPLIES FOR CLAIM AS
THE NEXT-OF-KIN TO THE DECEASED AS INDICATED IN OUR
BANKING GUIDELINES. UNFORTUNATELY, NEITHER THEIR
FAMILY MEMBER NOR DISTANTRELATIVE HAS EVER APPEARED TO
CLAIM THE SAID FUND. UPON THIS DISCOVERY,I AND  OTHER
OFFICIALS  IN MY DEPARTMENT HAVE AGREED TO MAKE
BUSINESS WITH YOU AND RELEASE THE TOTAL AMOUNT INTO
YOUR ACCOUNT AS THE HEIR OF THE FUND SINCE NO ONE CAME
FOR IT OR DISCOVERED HE MAINTAINED ACCOUNT WITH
OUR BANK, OTHERWISE THE FUND WILL BE RETURNED TO THE
BANKS TREASURY AS UNCLAIMED FUND. 
WE HAVE AGREED THAT OUR RATIO OF SHARING WILL BE
AS STATED THUS; 
30 % FOR YOU AS FOREIGN PARTNER, 
60 % FOR US THE OFFICIALS IN MY DEPARTMENT AND
10%  FOR THE SETTLEMENT OF ALL LOCAL AND
FOREIGN EXPENCES INCURRED BY US AND YOU DURING THE
COURSE OF THIS BUSINESS. UPON THE SUCCESSFUL
COMPLETION OF THIS TRANSFER, I AND ONE OF MY
COLLEAGUES 
WILL COME TO YOUR COUNTRY AND MIND OUR SHARE. IT
IS FROM OUR 60 % WE INTEND TO IMPORT AGRICULTURAL
MACHINERIES INTO MY COUNTRY AS A WAY OF RECYCLING THE
FUND. 
TO COMMENCE THIS TRANSACTION, WE REQUIRE YOU TO
IMMEDIATELY INDICATE YOUR  INTEREST BY A RETURN E-MAIL
AND ENCLOSE YOUR PRIVATE CONTACT TELEPHONE NUMBER, FAX
NUMBER FULL NAME AND ADDRESS AND YOUR DESIGNATED
BANK COORDINATES TO ENABLE US FILE LETTER OF CLAIM TO
THE APPROPRIATE DEPARTMENTS FOR  NECESSARY  APPROVALS
BEFORE THE TRANSFER CAN BE MADE. NOTE ALSO, THIS
TRANSACTION MUST BE KEPT  STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL
BECAUSE OF IT'S NATURE. 
PLEASE SEND YOUR RESPONSE TO:georgeokon@rccgmail.org 
I LOOK FORWARD TO RECEIVING YOUR PROMPT RESPONSE.
REGARDS, 
MR. GEORGE OKON 
WEMA BANK PLC.

messages.subject: TO MR GOKON
messages.body:
Cc: 	Farnes-Barnes


Dear Mr Gokon

We are amazed and somewhat perturbed that you should have obtained access to this e-mail address so easily, as it something of a state secret. However your amazing story has rather piqued our interest and, after discussing it, we feel that further discussion is in order.
As it happens, the recent flood at Lord Stringfellow's second residence has meant that we are to bear a large refurbishment cost shortly (his famously expansive portico was quite sodden and there is some severe undulation of the grotto) and this may prove extremely fortuitous.

Please reassure us first that you are serious and genuine. I am copying this into the Royal Treasurer, Sir Farnes Barnes as he may be involved I imagine.

Best wishes

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC 
Regis Court Chamberlain 
The Court of St James 
Broadmoor 
London FU2 GIT
messages.raw:
Sir Marmite Luny-Binns

Cc: Farnes-Barnes
Date: 24 Jun 2004, 01:26:28 AM

As it happens, the recent flood at Lord Stringfellow's second residence has meant that we are to bear a large refurbishment cost shortly (his famously expansive portico was quite sodden and there is some severe undulation of the grotto) and this may prove extremely fortuitous.

Please reassure us first that you are serious and genuine. I am copying this into the Royal Treasurer, Sir Farnes Barnes as he may be involved I imagine.

Best wishes

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC

Yours sincerely,

Charles Farnes-Barnes

Colonel Charles Farnes-Barnes

messages.subject: Thanks for responding to my email.
messages.body:
CC: Farnes-Barnes  

Dear Sir Marmite Loony-Binns,  
Thank you for responding to my email.I promise to keep 
to your instruction.  
This is real. I have the opportunity to know of this 
because of my position at the bank.We must not waste 
time. I have been praying for God to direct me to 
somebody who will be willing and sincere with this 
transaction.  
Send me your telephone/fax numbers and your banking 
particulars where you want the money transferred. As 
soon as you do this, I will submit it to the bank on 
your behalf.After which I send you a write-up which 
you will send to the bank instructing them to transfer 
the money into the account you have submitted earlier. 
When the bank contacts you, you must always get back 
to me so that I can advice you on what to say or do. 
We must not make mistakes. I have spent so much time 
and money to get this transaction to this stage.  
Henceforth contact me on this email 
address:georgeokon@yahoo.com Call me on phone 
number:234 803 3191186 so that I can explain further 
and get more acquinted with you.  
George Okon
messages.raw:
George Okon

From: George Okon georgeokon@yahoo.com
CC: Farnes-Barnes
Subject: Thanks for responding to my email.
Date: Thu, 24 Jun 2004 14:42:23 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Sir Marmite Loony-Binns,
Thank you for responding to my email.I promise to keep to your instruction.
This is real. I have the opportunity to know of this because of my position at the bank.We must not waste time. I have been praying for God to direct me to somebody who will be willing and sincere with this transaction.
Send me your telephone/fax numbers and your banking particulars where you want the money transferred. As soon as you do this, I will submit it to the bank on your behalf.After which I send you a write-up which you will send to the bank instructing them to transfer the money into the account you have submitted earlier. When the bank contacts you, you must always get back to me so that I can advice you on what to say or do. We must not make mistakes. I have spent so much time and money to get this transaction to this stage.
Henceforth contact me on this email address:georgeokon@yahoo.com Call me on phone number:234 803 3191186 so that I can explain further and get more acquinted with you.
George Okon

messages.body:
Dear Sir Marmite,

I am now staying out of this correspondence until he needs to know which currency he prefers - Argentinean pesos, Canadian dollars or Slovakian silver dorks.

Regards to your dear cousin Lord Bovril who I suggest you contact as he may be interested in taking a piece of the action.

Remain blessed,

Charles

messages.body:
Dear Mr Okon,

To facilitate any transaction, please continue to correspond with Sir Marmite Loony-Binns.

However,like Sir Marmite, just send me copies of your letters to him. This will speed matters up to the benefit of all concerned.

Incidentally, I wonder if you might be related to Dr Claud Okon of Enugu, a very dear friend of mine who unfortunately passed away in 1999. We studied together at Cambridge University back in the early 1960s.

Best wishes,


Colonel Charles Farnes-Barnes

Charles
messages.raw:
Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes

Kindest regards,

Charles

messages.body:
CC: Farnes-Barnes  
Sir Marmite,  
Please Sir I will appreciate if you can send me you 
full names tel/fax numbers and your banking 
particulars so that I can submit them to the bank 
today. I had expected you to do this on friday.It is 
important I submit them today.You don't have to waste 
time. The earlier we star the better for us.Call me on 
phone number:234 803 3191186 so that we can talk.I 
will like to brief you more on the transaction.I hope 
to hear from you as soon as possible.  
George Okon.

messages.body:
Dear Mr Okon,

Thank you for sending me a copy of your e-mail of 28 June to Sir Marmite Loony-Binns.

You might like to know that Sir Marmite spent the weekend in Scotland at the country home of His Excellency The Thane of Cawdor. I am sure he will answer your letter as soon as he returns to England.

Yours sincerely,
Charles Farnes-Barnes

messages.body:
Cc: 	Farnes-Barnes

My Dear Mr Okon

I am so sorry to hear that you have not yet received this information. I have been away bison hunting in Wales and had thought my equerry Ilichy Miracsky had done this already. Please accept my apologies. He can sometimes prove unreliable.

Ilichy also tells me your phone is not working. Please look into this. Perhaps a stray shell from the local fracas has hit the exchange?

My banking details are as follows:

Kustard Bank 
13 Rillington Place 
Usa Wanker 
London 
P1L 0CK

tel/fax 00 44 70 782 9283

The account is 6969419 
Account handler is Mr Glassov Vimto

Please let me know if you need any further details. I look forward to seeing the money in my balance and no doubt you will get what you deserve too.

MARMITE
messages.raw:
Sir Marmite Luny-Binns

To: georgeokon@yahoo.com
Cc: Farnes-Barnes
Date: 29 Jun 2004, 06:24:11 AM

messages.subject: to Farnes Barnes re Okon matter
messages.body:
Cc: 	georgeokon@yahoo.com

My dear Charles

Sorry about the delay old thing, Miracsky again, he found the drinks cabinet was unlocked. I have now given this native chappie what he wants. Cawdor sends his best wishes, and I have that bison trophy you want from Wales, ready for johnny taxidermist.

Golf still on this Friday?

M

Golf still on this Friday?

M

messages.body:
Cc: 	georgeokon@rccgmail.org

Dear Charles

This is an excellent idea. That number is a secure one, and I am sure the native chap will find it useful.

A splendid idea about Cawdor.  I will raise the matter with him when we next meet and let him in on the the ground floor. I know that his account at the Banquo Scotland is a little in need of replenishment following that costly inuguration of the Duchess of Duke Street.

MARMITE

messages.subject: You are not taking me serious.
messages.body:
CC: Farnes-Barnes 

Marmite Luny-Binns, 
Is like you are not taking this transaction serious. I
guess you are making fool of me. 
How come you sent me a wrong phone number again.If you
are serious, I want you to come me on 234 803 3191186
now. My phone is working. 
Have you heard from from the bank?i submited all the
particulars you sent me to them.I equally gave them
all instruction you gave me.As soon as you are
contacted, get back to me so that I can advice you on
what to do. 
George.

George Okon

Subject: You are not taking me serious.

Have you heard from from the bank?i submited all the particulars you sent me to them.I equally gave them all instruction you gave me.As soon as you are contacted, get back to me so that I can advice you on what to do.
George.

messages.body:
Cc: 	Farnes-Barnes

My dear Mr Okon

I greatly resent this accusation when, between the two of us, Mr Farnes Barnes and I have been doing our utmost to oil the wheels of commerce, as it were. As for giving out the wrong phone number, I can assure you that the receiver sits in my outer office (on a very fine Louis XIV desk as it happens) and is in perfect working order. If your tatty little native line cannot make contact then it hardly is my fault. While we are on the subject, I suggest that you check your own line once again. I have had my man Miracsky try a number of times to raise you, only to reach some sort of fast food outlet offer some ghastly monkey brain delicacy.

I doubt sir, if you are entirely serious. I had my suspicions, and these grow stronger by the day. I suggest that instead of this uppity town (to which I am entirely unused from the like of you) instead you and your gang get your own act in order and ensure that proper communicatons are set in order, rather than moping and whining like some banana republic costermonger on the make.

MARMITE
messages.raw:
Sir Marmite Luny-Binns

To: georgeokon@yahoo.com
Cc: Farnes-Barnes
Date: 02 Jul 2004, 04:57:18 AM

My dear Mr Okon

I greatly resent this accusation when, between the two of us, Mr Farnes Barnes and I have been doing our utmost to oil the wheels of commerce, as it were. As for giving out the wrong phone number, I can assure you that the receiver sits in my outer office (on a very fine Louis XIV desk as it happens) and is in perfect working order. If your tatty little native line cannot make contact then it hardly is my fault. While we are on the subject, I suggest that you check your own line once again. I have had my man Miracsky try a number of times to raise you, only to reach some sort of fast food outlet offer some ghastly monkey brain delicacy.

I doubt sir, if you are entirely serious. I had my suspicions, and these grow stronger by the day. I suggest that instead of this uppity town (to which I am entirely unused from the like of you) instead you and your gang get your own act in order and ensure that proper communicatons are set in order, rather than moping and whining like some banana republic costermonger on the make. MARMITE

messages.body:
Cc: 	Farnes-Barnes

Dear Mr Okon

I must admit that it has taken Charles Farnes Barnes a long time to bring me around to a degree of confidence in you after your previous outburst. However, despite my severe misgivings, he has finally managed to allay some of my more grievous misgivings, and we have reached a compromise of sorts.

Charles has suggested a small token representing mutual trust passes between yourself and us, perhaps a couple of dollars, upon which will rest our final judgement of the situation. If you wish to be represented as an honest man, as well as broker of our wishes, then he will provide the necessary details.

I am just off to Mount Bunter for a touch of skiiing, and hope that matters will be resolved with amicable fairness by the time I return.

MARMITE

PS Please do me the favour of spelling my name right old chap, this is not child's play you know.
messages.raw:
Sir Marmite Luny-Binns

Charles has suggested a small token representing mutual trust passes between yourself and us, perhaps a couple of dollars, upon which will rest our final judgement of the situation. If you wish to be represented as an honest man, as well as broker of our wishes, then he will provide the necessary details.

I am just off to Mount Bunter for a touch of skiiing, and hope that matters will be resolved with amicable fairness by the time I return.

MARMITE

messages.body:
My dear George

No word from the bank at the moment, I'm sorry to relate. Can you chivvy these chappies along somehow?

Incidentally my good friend Lord Bovril has expressed interest in sharing in with this deal, would that be a possibility? He has experience in such important matters with a prominent financial portfoliio and his stock holding is particularly well known.

MARMITE

Cc: 	georgeokon@yahoo.com, Lord Bovril

Dear Mr Adebite

I have indeed already received this, as you suggest, and I am concerned that you seem to be confused and introducing elements of dilly-dally into this enterprise. I believe that my business partner Mr Okon has been in contact as well. When exactly can we claim the money? This delay is very vexatious indeed, as I intended to spend next month in Monte Carlo and have to commission a new wardrobe from the royal tailor, Tatt & Bling.

MARMITE

Sir Marmite Luny-Binns DFC

messages.body:
Thane of Cawdor,
Am really happy to get your email.Indeed I never
wanted this transaction to spread the way it is going
because of my job with the bank.I wanted everything to
remain confidential till we are able to have the money
transferred into the account provided my  Marmite.
For the fact you are aware of it and willing to be
part of it,i wouldn't so no.This is on the ground that
you will given some percentage from my share because I
already have a percentage I promised Marmite for the
role he is playing.
We were asked to provide some documents by the bank.I
can source for two of them but they are going to cost
us some money.I will go for enquiry tomorrow money to
know the exact amount needed.When this is done.I
suggest we contribute towards getting the documents.
The earlier we get them the better for us.I suggest I
go for the documents by tuesday next week.
Please get back to me immediately let me know how you
feel about my suggestion.
George.
messages.raw:
George Okon

Date: Thu, 8 Jul 2004 14:55:31 -0700 (PDT)

Thane of Cawdor,
Am really happy to get your email.Indeed I never wanted this transaction to spread the way it is going because of my job with the bank.I wanted everything to remain confidential till we are able to have the money transferred into the account provided my Marmite. For the fact you are aware of it and willing to be part of it,i wouldn't so no.This is on the ground that you will given some percentage from my share because I already have a percentage I promised Marmite for the role he is playing.
We were asked to provide some documents by the bank.I can source for two of them but they are going to cost us some money.I will go for enquiry tomorrow money to know the exact amount needed.When this is done.I suggest we contribute towards getting the documents. The earlier we get them the better for us.I suggest I go for the documents by tuesday next week.
Please get back to me immediately let me know how you feel about my suggestion.
George.

messages.body:
CC: Lord Bovril

Marmite,
This is great.I know we are surely going to succeed.I
will be able to get the death and tax certificates but
they will cost me alot of money because they have to
be back dated.I will go to the people I will get the
certificates from by tomorrow to know how much they
will cost us.I will not be able to get the affidavit
of claims. It is only a registerred lawyer that can
get it.I know of a lawyer who can get it for us. His
name is BARRISTER OLU JACOBS.Contact him on phone
number:234 803 5859809 and email address:
olujacobsandassociates@justice.com Tell him your
cousin late engineer Steve Moore left your $15,000,000
at wema bank headquarters lagos.That the bank require
you to provide an affidavit before the money will be
remitted into your account.Tell him your friend in
Nigeria told you about him.He will do it. He is a well
known lawyer. He has been doing things like this for
his clints.
Contact him immediately and get back to me.
George.
messages.raw:
George Okon

CC: Lord Bovril
Date: Thu, 8 Jul 2004 14:04:30 -0700 (PDT)

Marmite,
This is great.I know we are surely going to succeed.I will be able to get the death and tax certificates but they will cost me alot of money because they have to be back dated.I will go to the people I will get the certificates from by tomorrow to know how much they will cost us.I will not be able to get the affidavit of claims. It is only a registerred lawyer that can get it.I know of a lawyer who can get it for us. His name is BARRISTER OLU JACOBS.Contact him on phone number:234 803 5859809 and email address: olujacobsandassociates@justice.com Tell him your cousin late engineer Steve Moore left your $15,000,000 at wema bank headquarters lagos.That the bank require you to provide an affidavit before the money will be remitted into your account.Tell him your friend in Nigeria told you about him.He will do it. He is a well known lawyer. He has been doing things like this for his clints.
Contact him immediately and get back to me.
George.

messages.body:
Cc: 	georgeokon@yahoo.com

My Dear Bovril

We are currently waiting to here back from the bank after having supplied some documentation. I really am in two minds about this whole affair as Okon & all seem to be at sixes and nines with this business but in the short term at least we shall need see what happens. Certainly some extra cash would come in useful, given the work that needs to be done to Stragonov Place.

Please give my regards to young Oxo and his mother.

MARMITE
